title: Semantik Architect  Frame Schema: Place
description: JSON schema for the PlaceFrame semantic structure used for geographic / place entities.

frame_type.description: Stable frame identifier; must be "place" for PlaceFrame instances.

main_entity.description: The place entity that this frame describes, typically mirroring semantics.types.Entity (id, name, entity_type, extra, etc.).

primary_kind.description: Coarse semantic kind of place, e.g. "country", "city", "river", "mountain", "airport", "stadium".

locations.description: Zero or more Location-like objects describing where this place is situated (e.g. continent, country, region).

items.description: A generic location object, typically matching semantics.types.Location (id, name, kind, extra, etc.).

admin_level.description: Optional administrative level indicator, where lower numbers usually mean higher-level units (e.g. 0=nation, 1=region, 2=province, 3=municipality).

timespan.description: Coarse TimeSpan-like object describing the existence or relevant period of the place (e.g. founding and dissolution years).

approximate.description: Whether the span is approximate rather than exact.

extra.description: Optional additional metadata for the time span.

population_timespan.description: TimeSpan-like object indicating when the population value applies (e.g. census year or period).

start_year.description: Year or start year for the population figure.

end_year.description: Optional end year, for multi-year ranges.

approximate.description: Whether the population time span is approximate.

extra.description: Optional additional metadata for the population time span.

area_km2.description: Area of the place in square kilometres, if known.

elevation_m.description: Elevation in metres above sea level, if applicable (e.g. for mountains, cities, plateaus).

parent_entities.description: Zero or more parent / containing entities, represented as generic Entity-like objects (e.g. country, region, municipality).

items.description: An Entity-like object for the parent; typically includes id, name, entity_type, and extra.

attributes.description: Open-ended attribute map for additional structured facts about the place (climate, codes, nicknames, etc.). Keys should be strings.

extra.description: Free-form metadata bag for provenance, debug info, or original-source fields that are not directly interpreted by NLG.
